Description: Lower body fragment of a large East Greek pottery closed vase, slipped very pale brown (10 YR 7/3) on the exterior. Inside reserved; outside, above broad black band, in silhouette, thinly spaced lotus and bud frieze, the glaze fired to reddish-brown (2.5 YR 4/4).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 59, no. 215 pl. 49)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.686)
